app package¶

Submodules¶

app.database module¶

class app.database.InventoryTable(url: str, key: str)¶

Bases: object

Manages the inventory database table.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – The Supabase database URL.

  • key (str) – The Supabase API key.

Variables:

  • client (Client) – The Supabase client for database operations.

  • table (SyncRequestBuilder) – The inventory table for database queries.

add_good_to_db(good: Good)¶

Adds a new inventory item to the database.

Parameters:

good (Good) – The Good object containing the item details.

Returns:

The response data from the database after insertion.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception – If the item could not be added to the database.

deduct_good_from_db(good_id: int)¶

Deducts one unit from the stock of an inventory item by its ID.

Parameters:

good_id (int) – The ID of the item to deduct.

Returns:

The response data from the database after deduction.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the item stock is already zero.

  • Exception – If the inventory update fails.

get_good_from_db(good_id: int)¶

Retrieves an inventory item by its ID.

Parameters:

good_id (int) – The ID of the item to retrieve.

Returns:

The details of the retrieved item.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception – If the item could not be fetched from the database.

update_good_in_db(good_id: int, updated_good: GoodUpdate)¶

Updates an existing inventory item in the database.

Parameters:

  • good_id (int) – The ID of the item to update.

  • updated_good (GoodUpdate) – The fields to update as a GoodUpdate object.

Returns:

The response data from the database after the update.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

  • ValueError – If no fields are provided for the update.

  • Exception – If the item could not be updated in the database.

dict

Retrieves an inventory item by its ID.

The details of the requested inventory item.

dict

  • good (GoodUpdate) – The updated details of the item.

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the item is not found or if an error occurs during the update process.

app.models module¶

class app.models.Category(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)¶

Bases: str, Enum

ACCESSORIES = 'accessories'¶
CLOTHES = 'clothes'¶
ELECTRONICS = 'electronics'¶
FOOD = 'food'¶
class app.models.Good(*, name: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=100)], category: Literal['food', 'clothes', 'accessories', 'electronics'], price: Annotated[float, Gt(gt=0)], description: Annotated[str, MaxLen(max_length=255)], count: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=0)])¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represents an inventory item.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the item (maximum length: 100 characters).

  • category (Literal["food", "clothes", "accessories", "electronics"]) – The category of the item. Must be one of [‘food’, ‘clothes’, ‘accessories’, ‘electronics’].

  • price (float) – The price of the item. Must be greater than 0.

  • description (str) – A brief description of the item (maximum length: 255 characters).

  • count (int) – The number of items available in stock. Must be non-negative.

count: int¶
description: str¶

class app.models.GoodUpdate(*, name: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=100)] = None, category: Category | None = None, price: Annotated[float | None, Gt(gt=0)] = None, description: Annotated[str | None, MaxLen(max_length=255)] = None, count: Annotated[int | None, Ge(ge=0)] = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Represents the fields for updating an inventory item.

Parameters:

  • name (Optional[str]) – The new name of the item (maximum length: 100 characters). Optional.

  • category (Optional[Category]) – The new category of the item. Must be one of [‘food’, ‘clothes’, ‘accessories’, ‘electronics’]. Optional.

  • price (Optional[float]) – The new price of the item. Must be greater than 0. Optional.

  • description (Optional[str]) – The new description of the item (maximum length: 255 characters). Optional.

  • count (Optional[int]) – The new stock count of the item. Must be non-negative. Optional.

category: Category | None¶
count: int | None¶
description: str | None¶

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

app.service module¶

app.service.add_good(good: Good)¶

Adds a new inventory item to the database.

Parameters:

good (Good) – The Good object containing the item details to add.

Returns:

A success message confirming the item was added.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception – If the database operation fails.

app.service.deduct_good(good_id: int)¶

Deducts one unit from the stock of an inventory item.

Parameters:

good_id (int) – The ID of the item to deduct stock from.

Returns:

A success message confirming the stock was deducted.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the stock is already zero or the item does not exist.

  • Exception – If the database operation fails.

app.service.get_good(good_id: int)¶

Retrieves an inventory item by its ID.

Parameters:

good_id (int) – The ID of the item to retrieve.

Returns:

The details of the retrieved item.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError – If the item with the given ID does not exist.

app.service.update_good(good_id: int, good_update: GoodUpdate)¶

Updates an existing inventory item in the database.

Parameters:

  • good_id (int) – The ID of the item to update.

  • good_update (GoodUpdate) – The fields to update for the item.

Returns:

A success message confirming the item was updated.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the item with the given ID does not exist.

  • Exception – If the database operation fails.
